intro: Rondeletia byrsophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
